commit.title: [error] Remove special error printing pre-processing
commit.message:
[error] Remove special error printing pre-processing

We remove the special error printing pre-processing in favor of just
calling the standard printers.

Error printing has been a mess for a while due to an incomplete
migration to a new printing scheme based on registering exception
printers; this PR should alleviate that; however the mess is still
big, in particular with regards of `Exninfo.info` handling, so we
should consider this patch a work in progress.

After this cleanup, it should not be ever necessary for normal
functions to worry about catching errors and re-raising them, unless
they have some very special needs.

Some amount of testing has been done and things seem to work OK.

Some amount of spurious diffs are here due to issues with the
pre-commit whitespace hook not being happy.

printers; this PR should alleviate that; however the mess is still
big, in particular with regards of `Exninfo.info` handling, so we
should consider this patch a work in progress.

After this cleanup, it should not be ever necessary for normal
functions to worry about catching errors and re-raising them, unless
they have some very special needs.

Some amount of testing has been done and things seem to work OK.

Some amount of spurious diffs are here due to issues with the
pre-commit whitespace hook not being happy.

commit.title: [error] Remove special error printing pre-processing
commit.message:
[error] Remove special error printing pre-processing

We remove the special error printing pre-processing in favor of just
calling the standard printers.

Error printing has been a mess for a while due to an incomplete
migration to a new printing scheme based on registering exception
printers; this PR should alleviate that; however the mess is still
big, in particular with regards of `Exninfo.info` handling, so we
should consider this patch a work in progress.

After this cleanup, it should not be ever necessary for normal
functions to worry about catching errors and re-raising them, unless
they have some very special needs.

Some amount of testing has been done and things seem to work OK.

Some amount of spurious diffs are here due to issues with the
pre-commit whitespace hook not being happy.
